Donated amounts will be allocated and dispersed to the Northern California Chapter if the Company sees fit. Beginning on the first full quarter [three (3) month period] of the Agreement, or at any time thereafter, the Company may reassess this arrangement. perturbation.explanation: The original clause clearly states a donation will be made. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by stating the donation is at the discretion of the company, undermining the enforceability of the original financial commitment. This contradicts the clarity and obligation intended in a legally binding agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Clear and unambiguous terms

perturbation.changed_text: The Company may, if it deems necessary, provide to the NFLA-NC upon request, a potentially outdated or incomplete version of a sales report, the details of which are subject to change without notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates provision of sales reports on request. This undermines the NFLA-NC's ability to verify donation amounts, creating a legal contradiction by diminishing transparency and accountability.

perturbation.original_text: All amendments to this Agreement must be signed by all parties to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Amendments to this agreement should ideally be signed by all parties to this agreement, but verbal communication would suffice for smaller issues.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause necessitates written consent for amendments, ensuring mutual agreement and clear record-keeping. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by suggesting verbal agreements are acceptable for 'smaller issues', undermining the original requirement for written consent. This contradiction creates uncertainty and disputes, weakening the contract's enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Modification of Contract Terms
